content: Indrė ŽliobaitėSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationIndrė ŽliobaitėI am a professor at the  University of Helsinki in Finland, where I lead a research group on Computational data analysis. Our research is interdisciplinary focusing on computational approaches for understanding change processes in nature and society. We also contribute to the theory and practice of trustworthy machine learning, ethics and philosophy of AI.Keywords: data science, macroevolution, macroecology, concept drift, change detection, long term forecasting, trustworthy machine learning, robust machine learning, philosophy of AI, ethics of AI and AI for science.Google Scholar     My  research group      ORCID       UHResearchPortal       My research blog     What's up?December 2025 » The final public seminar of HAT research project will take place in Turku on December 12.
